config.description: config container for IGMP vrf instance configurations

disable-ssm-map.description: Use this attribute to enable the IGMP operation on an interface. This command enables IGMP operation in standalone mode, and can be used to learn local-membership information prior to enabling a multicast routing protocol on the interface. This command will has no effect on interfaces configured for IGMP proxy.

disable-tos-check.description: Use this attribute to disable TOS check for Internetwork Control

state.description: state container for IGMP vrf instance configurations

disable-ssm-map.description: Use this attribute to enable the IGMP operation on an interface. This command enables IGMP operation in standalone mode, and can be used to learn local-membership information prior to enabling a multicast routing protocol on the interface. This command will has no effect on interfaces configured for IGMP proxy.

disable-tos-check.description: Use this attribute to disable TOS check for Internetwork Control

config.description: config container for IGMP group membership control configurations

member-limit.description: Use this attribute to set the maximum number of group membership states, at either the router level or at the interface level. Once the specified number of group memberships is reached, all further local-memberships are ignored. Optionally, an exception access-list can be configured to specify the group-address(es) to be excluded from being subject to the limit. This command applies to interfaces configured for IGMP Layer-3 multicast protocols and IGMP Proxy. The limit applies, individually, to each of its constituent interfaces.

limit-exception-acl.description: Use this attribute to set the maximum number of group membership states, at either the router level or at the interface level. Once the specified number of group memberships is reached, all further local-memberships are ignored. Optionally, an exception access-list can be configured to specify the group-address(es) to be excluded from being subject to the limit. This command applies to interfaces configured for IGMP Layer-3 multicast protocols and IGMP Proxy. The limit applies, individually, to each of its constituent interfaces.

state.description: state container for IGMP group membership control configurations

member-limit.description: Use this attribute to set the maximum number of group membership states, at either the router level or at the interface level. This command applies to interfaces configured for IGMP Layer-3 multicast protocols and IGMP Proxy. The limit applies, individually, to each of its constituent interfaces.

This command applies to interfaces configured for IGMP Layer-3 multicast protocols and IGMP Proxy. The limit applies, individually, to each of its constituent interfaces.

current-states-count.description: Current group membership record states for this IGMP instance.

group-ranges-acl.description: Use this attribute to specify SSM Static Access List

source.description: Use this attribute to specify the static mode of defining SSM mapping. SSM mapping statically assigns sources to IGMPv1 and IGMPv2 groups to translate such (star G) groups memberships to (S,G) memberships for use with PIMSSM.This attribute applies to interfaces configured for IGMP Layer-3 multicast protocols and IGMP Proxy.

config.description: config container for IGMP static-mapping configurations

group-ranges-acl.description: Use this attribute to specify SSM Static Access List

source.description: Use this attribute to specify the static mode of defining SSM mapping. SSM mapping statically assigns sources to IGMPv1 and IGMPv2 groups to translate such (star G) groups memberships to (S,G) memberships for use with PIMSSM.This attribute applies to interfaces configured for IGMP Layer-3 multicast protocols and IGMP Proxy.

config.description: config container for IGMP debug configurations

options.description: Use this attribute to enable igmp debugging configurations

state.description: state container for IGMP debug configurations

options.description: Use this attribute to enable igmp debugging configurations

terminal-debug-status.description: Use this attribute to display igmp terminal debug options enabled

interfaces.description: Top level container for IGMP interfaces

name.description: This attribute defines the interface where IGMP is configured

config.description: config container for IGMP interface instance configurations

name.description: This attribute defines the interface where IGMP is configured

enabled.description: Use this attribute to enable the IGMP operation on an interface. This attributeenables IGMP operation in standalone mode, and can be used to learn local-membership information prior to enabling a multicast routing protocol on the interface. This attribute will have no effect on interfaces configured for IGMP proxy

last-member-query-count.description: Use this attribute to set the last-member query-count value. This attribute applies to interfaces configured for IGMP Layer-3 multicast protocols and IGMP Proxy.

last-member-query-interval.description: Use this attribute to configure the frequency at which the router sends IGMP group-specific host query messages. This attribute applies to interfaces configured for IGMP Layer-3 multicast protocols and IGMP Proxy.

querier-timeout.description: Use this attribute to set the timeout period before the router takes over as the querier for the interface after the previous querier has stopped querying. This attribute applies to interfaces configured for IGMP Layer-3 multicast protocols and IGMP Proxy.

query-interval.description: Use this attribute to set the frequency of sending IGMP host query messages. This attribute applies to interfaces configured for IGMP Layer-3 multicast protocols and IGMP Proxy.

query-max-response-time.description: Use this attribute to set the maximum response time advertised in IGMP queries. This attribute applies to interfaces configured for IGMP Layer-3 multicast protocols and IGMP Proxy.

startup-query-interval.description: Use this attribute to set a query interval value for IGMP

startup-query-count.description: Use this attribute to set a startup query count for IGMP

robustness-variable.description: Use this attribute to set the robustness variable value on an interface. This attribute applies to interfaces configured for IGMP Layer-3 multicast protocols and IGMP Proxy.

version.description: Use this attribute to set the current IGMP protocol version on an interface. This attribute applies to interfaces configured for IGMP Layer-3 multicast protocols and IGMP Proxy.

require-router-alert-option.description: Use this attribute to configure strict Router Advertisement validation for IGMP.

allow-offlink-host.description: Use this attribute to configure off-link for IGMP.

state.description: state container for IGMP interface instance configurations

v1-reports-received.description: Number of IGMPv1 reports received on this interface.

v2-reports-received.description: Number of IGMPv2 reports received on this interface.

v2-leaves-received.description: Number of IGMPv2 leaves received on this interface.

v3-reports-received.description: Number of IGMPv3 reports received on this interface.

current-group-records.description: Number of current group membership records on this interface.

internet-address.description: Interface IP address used by IGMP to communicate with remote peer

oper-status.description: Operational status of the IGMP interface

is-querier.description: Indicates whether this interface is a IGMP querier or not.

querying-router.description: IGMP querying router for this subnet

group-membership-interval.description: Time interval after which the group memberships on this interface will time out.

name.description: This attribute defines the interface where IGMP is configured

enabled.description: Use this attribute to enable the IGMP operation on an interface. This attributeenables IGMP operation in standalone mode, and can be used to learn local-membership information prior to enabling a multicast routing protocol on the interface. This attribute will have no effect on interfaces configured for IGMP proxy

last-member-query-count.description: Use this attribute to set the last-member query-count value. This attribute applies to interfaces configured for IGMP Layer-3 multicast protocols and IGMP Proxy.

last-member-query-interval.description: Use this attribute to configure the frequency at which the router sends IGMP group-specific host query messages. This attribute applies to interfaces configured for IGMP Layer-3 multicast protocols and IGMP Proxy.

querier-timeout.description: Use this attribute to set the timeout period before the router takes over as the querier for the interface after the previous querier has stopped querying. This attribute applies to interfaces configured for IGMP Layer-3 multicast protocols and IGMP Proxy.

query-interval.description: Use this attribute to set the frequency of sending IGMP host query messages. This attribute applies to interfaces configured for IGMP Layer-3 multicast protocols and IGMP Proxy.

query-max-response-time.description: Use this attribute to set the maximum response time advertised in IGMP queries. This attribute applies to interfaces configured for IGMP Layer-3 multicast protocols and IGMP Proxy.

startup-query-interval.description: Use this attribute to set a query interval value for IGMP

startup-query-count.description: Use this attribute to set a startup query count for IGMP

robustness-variable.description: Use this attribute to set the robustness variable value on an interface. This attribute applies to interfaces configured for IGMP Layer-3 multicast protocols and IGMP Proxy.

version.description: Use this attribute to set the current IGMP protocol version on an interface. This attribute applies to interfaces configured for IGMP Layer-3 multicast protocols and IGMP Proxy.

require-router-alert-option.description: Use this attribute to configure strict Router Advertisement validation for IGMP.

allow-offlink-host.description: Use this attribute to configure off-link for IGMP.

config.description: config container for IGMP proxy configurations

enable-proxy-service.description: Use this attribute to designate an interface to be the IGMP proxy-service (upstream host-side) interface, thus enabling IGMP host-side protocol operation on this interface. All associated downstream router-side interfaces will have their memberships consolidated on this interface, according to IGMP host-side functionality

mroute-proxy-interface.description: Use this attribute to specify the IGMP Proxy service interface with which to be associated. IGMP router-side protocol operation is enabled only when the specified upstream proxy-service interface is functional.

unsolicited-report-interval.description: Use this attribute to set an unsolicited report interval for an interface designated as an IGMP proxy

state.description: state container for IGMP proxy configurations

enable-proxy-service.description: Use this attribute to designate an interface to be the IGMP proxy-service (upstream host-side) interface, thus enabling IGMP host-side protocol operation on this interface. All associated downstream router-side interfaces will have their memberships consolidated on this interface, according to IGMP host-side functionality

mroute-proxy-interface.description: Use this attribute to specify the IGMP Proxy service interface with which to be associated. IGMP router-side protocol operation is enabled only when the specified upstream proxy-service interface is functional.

unsolicited-report-interval.description: Use this attribute to set an unsolicited report interval for an interface designated as an IGMP proxy

group-membership-control.description: IGMP inteface group membership control configurations

config.description: config container for IGMP group membership control configurations

access-group-name.description: Use this attribute to control the multicast local-membership groups learned on an interface. This attribute applies to interfaces configured for IGMP Layer-3 multicast protocols, IGMP proxy.

immediate-leave-groups-list.description: In IGMP version 2, use this attribute to minimize the leave latency of IGMP memberships. This attribute is used when only one receiver host is connected to each interface. This command applies to interfaces configured for IGMP Layer-3 multicast protocols, IGMP Proxy.

member-limit.description: Use this attribute to set the maximum number of group membership states, at either the router level or at the interface level. Once the specified number of group memberships is reached, all further local-memberships are ignored. Optionally, an exception access-list can be configured to specify the group-address to be excluded from being subject to the limit.

limit-exception-acl.description: Use this attribute to set the maximum number of group membership states, at either the router level or at the interface level. Once the specified number of group memberships is reached, all further local-memberships are ignored. Optionally, an exception access-list can be configured to specify the group-address to be excluded from being subject to the limit.

state.description: state container for IGMP group membership control configurations

access-group-name.description: Use this attribute to control the multicast local-membership groups learned on an interface. This attribute applies to interfaces configured for IGMP Layer-3 multicast protocols, IGMP proxy.

immediate-leave-groups-list.description: In IGMP version 2, use this attribute to minimize the leave latency of IGMP memberships. This attribute is used when only one receiver host is connected to each interface. This command applies to interfaces configured for IGMP Layer-3 multicast protocols, IGMP Proxy.

asm-static-group.description: IGMP interface asm static group instance configurations

group-address.description: Use this attribute to statically configure group membership entries on an interface. To statically add only a group membership, do not specify any parameters. This attribute applies to IGMP operation on a specific interface to statically add group and/or source records on a VLAN interface to statically add group and/or source records.
